title: The Boast
shortDescription: The hare mocks the tortoise and challenges him.
chapterTextTemplate: Every day the proud [HARE] would [CHAT] about every [RACE] he had won. His loud voice felt like [HEAT] in the air, and everyone could [HEAR] him. The tortoise walked with great [CARE], keeping close to the [EARTH]. Others laughed, but he did not [TEAR] up or hide his small [EAR]. He kept calm and listened to his own [HEART].

title: The Race
shortDescription: The race begins; the hare runs ahead and rests.
chapterTextTemplate: The path felt [SOFT] in the morning. The hare ran [FAST] while the tortoise moved [SLOW]. The hare’s feet made a quick [FLOW] of dust. He thought the tortoise would finish [LAST], so he rested and soon felt [LOST] in sleep. The tortoise took [LOTS] of small steps and did not [STOW] his effort away. A cool breeze made leaves [WAFT], and the hare dreamed of a tasty [LOAF].

title: The Finish
shortDescription: The tortoise keeps going and wins.
chapterTextTemplate: The tortoise walked with a [STEADY] pace. He chose to [STAY] calm and kept his eyes on his [SEAT] of focus inside his mind. Friends cheered from the [EAST] and the [WEST]. There are many [WAYS] to win, he thought, if you try each [DAY]. At the end, everyone shouted [YES]! They shared warm [TEA] and smiled as he crossed the line to [EAT] his simple reward.

title: The Lion Sleeps
shortDescription: A tiny mouse wakes a lion and begs to go free.
chapterTextTemplate: In the tall grass, the mighty [LION] slept. A little [MOUSE] ran over his [PAW]. The lion gave a loud [ROAR], but then showed [MERCY]. He decided to let the mouse go [FREE]. The mouse was [SMALL], yet tried to [AMUSE] the lion with brave words. It promised to [SAVE] him one day and help him [SOAR] past trouble.

title: The Trap
shortDescription: Hunters catch the lion in a net and rope.
chapterTextTemplate: The lion stepped into a [TRAP]. A strong [ROPE] pulled tight, and a wide [NET] wrapped the [LION]. He gave a fierce [ROAR] and cried for [HELP]. The little [MOUSE] heard him and ran close. It began to [CHEW] the knots so the lion could be [FREE]. At last, the mouse helped [SAVE] him from danger.

title: The Rescue
shortDescription: The mouse rescues the lion; kindness returns.
chapterTextTemplate: The mouse came to [SAVE] the lion. It worked until he was [FREE]. It bit through each [ROPE] and kept on [CHEW]ing carefully. The [LION] watched the [MOUSE] with respect. With the mouse’s [HELP], the lion was [SAFE]. The lion thanked the mouse with [KIND] words, and their friendship began to [SOAR].
